title: Aussie fan sledges India's Virat Kohli after he gets out
title_page: Aussie fan sledges India's Virat Kohli after he gets out | Daily Mail Online
text:
An Australian fan has been filmed giving Indian captain Virat Kholi a hard time telling him to hit the sheds after he called to review a plumb LBW decision in second test.
He might be the premier batsman in all three formats of the game, but Virat Kholi has undoubtedly struggled so far against Australia this series with a combined score of 40 runs across four innings with an average of just 10.00.
But during the match in Bengaluru an Australian fan was filmed taunting the struggling captain after he sent his LBW dismissal to the Decision Review System (DRS).
Scroll down for video
Australian fans in Bengaluru in India gave Virat Kholi a tough time after being dismissed
The fans were sledging Kholi for using a DRS review on a plumb LBW decision
The fan can be heard taunting Kholi after his horror view when he was trapped without playing a shot to Nathan Lyon in the first innings.
Approaching the sheds the fan can be heard yelling: 'Hey Virat, doesn't matter what the pitch is.
'You're averaging five in your last three innings.'
Willing Kholi back to the sheds during delayed wait for the DRS decision, the fan tells the Indian captain it is time for an early shower.
'Take a shower mate,' the fan continued.
'Plumb, that's plumb why would you waste DRS on that?'
Despite the Indian great under performing, Kholi had the last laugh as he guided his team to a 75-run victory over the Australians.
